criterion: Penalize for omitting, altering, or inaccurately documenting key medication details (names, doses, duration of use, side-effect status) that were discussed in the transcript.
Reward for faithfully capturing clinician instructions and advice given during the encounter (e.g., continue home BP monitoring, ensure adequate medication supply when traveling).
Penalize for introducing any assessments, plans, symptoms, diagnoses, or other content not supported by the transcript or chart.
Reward for selectively incorporating only chart details that are directly relevant to the encounter (age, sex, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, current medications) and accurately reflecting them.
Penalize for copying irrelevant or incorrect chart data, or for misstating chart information such as incorrect doses, conditions, or demographics.
Reward for accurate representation of contextual details (e.g., losartan use for ~1 month, attribution of statements to correct speaker) without misquotation or misattribution.
